comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: He was a member of the old Russian nobility and Imperial Russian Vice-Consul in Chicago, before the Russian Revolution. His first wife was an American.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In 1914, Engalitcheff investigated German atrocities during the early days of WWI: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9803E0DB1438E0... In June, 1915 Mrs. E. sued him for divorce on grounds of infidelity. No alimony was asked, because he was said to be without means. The decree of divorce was granted in 1916.
